attributes.action: Introduce basic UK political knowledge into secondary school curriculum
attributes.additional_details: There are many young people who are highly uninterested in British politics, which a lot of the time can lead to wasted votes as people either do not vote or they vote based on how much they like the leader's character.
attributes.background: Introduce basic UK political knowledge into secondary school curriculum in PSHE / Citizenships and Values, with what each political party stands for, who people vote and why, and manifestos

rejection.details:
The key stage 3 and 4 curriculums for Citizenship already include teaching about democracy, government and how laws are made and upheld. 

You can read more here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/national-curriculum-in-england-citizenship-programmes-of-study/national-curriculum-in-england-citizenship-programmes-of-study-for-key-stages-3-and-4

If you would like Politics to be a compulsory subject in its own right, or the content of the curriculum to change, you could start a petition about that.
